text:
(1)
Ferris Ave., north from Jay Place, showing the avenue being reconstructed as the main approach to the new Bronx-Whitestone Bridge. In the distant background is visible St. Joseph's Institute for the Improved Instruction of Deaf Mutes.

May 1, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
North along the avenue from near Philip Ave.

May 1, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
Looking north across the west side of the road, from a point below Lafayette Ave., and showing one of the units of St. Joseph's Institute for the Improved Instruction of Deaf Mutes.

May 1, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

Bronx-Whitestone Bridge: A view of the bridge under construction, as seen from the Bronx, near Old Ferry Point. This is a set of three views taken the same day.

May 1, 1938.

P. L. Sperr
title: Bridges - Bronx-Whitestone Bridge - [Old Ferry Point.]

text:
Bronx-Whitestone Bridge: Viewing north on the East River from Clason Point, Bronx, and showing the $18,000,000 bridge connecting Old Ferry Point, the Bronx, with Whitestone, Queens. View 2 shows the Bronx end of the structure on Old Ferry Point. For additional data see "The New York Times," April 30, 1939.

August 18, 1940
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr
title: Bridges - Bronx-Whitestone Bridge - [Old Ferry Point, Bronx - Whitestone, Queens.]
